👋 About Me

I’m Yuxuan Xie, currently a PhD student at Institute of Geographic Sciences and Natural Resources Research, Chinese Academy of Sciences. My research focuses on evapotranspiration (ET) and land–atmosphere interactions within the field of eco-hydrology. I’m passionate about scientific programming, especially with R, Python, and Julia, and I enjoy developing efficient packages for data analysis and model simulation.

Education

Institute of Geographic Sciences and Natural Resources Research, Chinese Academy of Sciences, China | Ph.D. in Physical Geography | Sept 2025 - Now

China University of Geosciences (Wuhan), China | M.S in Atmospheric Science | Sept 2022 - June 2025

China University of Geosciences (Wuhan), China | B.A in Hydrology and Water Resources Engineering | Sept 2018 - June 2022
